org.bremersee.fac

Class FailedAccessCounterImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bremersee.fac.FailedAccessCounterImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FailedAccessCounter

    public class FailedAccessCounterImpl
extends Object
implements FailedAccessCounter

    Default failed access counter implementation. It can use any store that implements FailedAccessDao. It uses an internal thread for removing obsolete failed access entries. So it is important that the failed access counter is started and stopped properly (see start() and stop()).

    Author:
    Christian Bremer

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FailedAccessCounterImpl()
      Default constructor.

      • accessSucceeded

        public AccessResultDto accessSucceeded(String resourceId,
                                       String remoteHost,
                                       Long timeInMillis)
        Description copied from interface: FailedAccessCounter
        Tells the access failed store that the access from the remote host to the specified resource was successfully. If the counter of the failed access entry is already higher than the threshold of the store, the access to the resource will stay blocked, otherwise the access is granted.
        Specified by:
        accessSucceeded in interface FailedAccessCounter
        Parameters:
        resourceId - the resource
        remoteHost - the remote host
        timeInMillis - the current time stamp (may be null)
        Returns:
        the access result

      • accessFailed

        public AccessResultDto accessFailed(String resourceId,
                                    String remoteHost,
                                    Long timeInMillis)
        Description copied from interface: FailedAccessCounter
        Stores a failed access entry for the specified resource and remote host. If an entry already exists, the counter will be incremented. If the counter of the failed access entry is lower than the threshold of the store, the access to the resource is not blocked otherwise it is blocked.
        Specified by:
        accessFailed in interface FailedAccessCounter
        Parameters:
        resourceId - the resource
        remoteHost - the remote host
        timeInMillis - the current time stamp (may be null)
        Returns:
        the access result

        Specified by:
        isAccessGranted in interface FailedAccessCounter
        Parameters:
        resourceId - the resource
        remoteHost - the remote host
        Returns:
        the access result
